name: Paidy (iOS/Android Apps)
notes:
Only 1 passkey can be registered per account.
Passkey can only be registered from the app (iOS / Android).

name: Adobe
notes:
Click the setup link and sign in with your email address and password, then click Add in the Passkeys section and follow the steps to create a passkey.

Sign out, then click "Sign in with passkey" when you sign back in to use your passkey.

name: Air New Zealand
notes: Passkey upgrade will be offered after creating an account or signing in.

name: Air New Zealand
notes: Passkey upgrade will be offered after creating an account or signing in.

name: Air New Zealand (Australia)
notes: Passkey upgrade will be offered after creating an account or signing in.

name: Amazon UK
notes:
Amazon is actively rolling out sign in with passkey support. Setting up a passkey on Amazon needs to meet one of the minimum software requirements of iOS 16, macOS Big Sur, or Android 9 (if applicable).

#### To set up a passkey on your Amazon account:

1. In Your Account, select Login & Security.
2. Select Set up next to Passkey.
3. Select Set up.
4. Follow the instructions provided to complete setting up a passkey.

Signing in to different Amazon marketplaces (Amazon.co.uk compared to Amazon.com for example) requires either a new passkey for that specific marketplace or using your Amazon password.

name: Amazon
notes:
Amazon is actively rolling out sign in with passkey support. Setting up a passkey on Amazon needs to meet one of the minimum software requirements of iOS 16, macOS Big Sur, or Android 9 (if applicable).

#### To set up a passkey on your Amazon account:

1. In Your Account, select Login & Security.
2. Select Set up next to Passkey.
3. Select Set up.
4. Follow the instructions provided to complete setting up a passkey.

Signing in to different Amazon marketplaces (Amazon.co.uk compared to Amazon.com for example) requires either a new passkey for that specific marketplace or using your Amazon password.

name: Apple
notes:
Passkeys for Apple accounts are automatically generated by any Apple devices signed in to an Apple ID running iOS 17 or macOS Sonoma or newer. You will then be able to sign in with passkeys on Apple using any iOS device or Mac signed in to the same Apple ID you are signing in to.

If you are using a different browser or device, such as a Windows PC or Mac signed in with a different Apple ID, you can scan the QR code using your iOS device and sign in with passkeys on Apple.

You are not yet able to save passkeys for Apple ID accounts in third-party credential managers and can only be stored in iCloud Passwords at this time.

name: Arbeitsagentur
notes:
#### To set up a passkey: 1. Log in to your account 2. Select “Set up passkey” 3. Select “Create Passkey” 4. Create a new passkey on your device #### Supported browsers and devices: • macOS Ventura or newer\ • Windows 10 or 11\ • iOS 16 or newer\ • Android 9 or newer\ • Chrome 109+\ • Safari 16+\ • Edge 109+

Updated on September 22, 2025

name: Arpari
notes: Powered by Passage by 1Password.

name: Best Buy
notes:
Use the setup link provided and sign in with your email address and password, then follow the steps to create a passkey.

Sign out, then choose Sign In with a Passkey when you sign back in to use your passkey.

name: BMW
notes: BMW now supports signing in to your BMW ID with a passkey. Instructions on saving a passkey to your BMW ID may vary from region to region but more information can be found in the Account Data section of your BMW ID profile.

name: Bolt
notes: This feature is currently in a testing phase. As a result, it may not be available to all users at this time.

name: Chek
notes: Powered by Passage by 1Password.

name: Cloze
notes:
### To add a passkey to your account

From the side menu bar:
1. Select (••• more)
2. Select, settings
3. Expand 'your account' and select [Add] passkeys

name: Bitwarden Community Forums
notes: Visit preferences, security after signing in to manage passkeys.

name: Coveto Recruiting Software
notes:
Setup link not available.

Manage passkeys from user menu in top right, Settings,  MFA

name: CVS
notes:
*Register individual passkeys using iOS with Safari or Edge*

**Note:** Saving and signing in with passkeys on CVS.com is currently incompatible with 1Password in the browser and other third-party passkey managers on iOS.

1. On your iOS device, go to CVS.com and sign in.
2. When prompted, save a passkey using 1Password and follow the on-screen instructions.

name: Dell
notes:
#### To set up a passkey on your Dell.com account: 1. Sign into Dell.com 2. Select your account name at the top right 3. **Profile Settings** 4. **Edit Profile** 5. **Security Settings** 6. **Add Passkey** #### Supported browsers and devices: • macOS Ventura or newer\ • Windows 10 or 11\ • Chrome 109+ _There is a known issue on Windows devices where Windows Hello prompts alongside 1Password. Close (X) the Windows Hello prompt and click **Sign in** in the 1Password prompt as a temporary workaround._

Updated on September 17, 2025

ref: AUTH-1413

name: Discord (Beta)
notes:
Currently, it's only possible to authenticate to Discord with a passkey on mobile apps and desktop beta apps, and not using the web app via a desktop browser or the stable desktop app.

https://support.discord.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035675191-Discord-Testing-Clients

name: Discourse
notes: Passkeys can be setup within members account preferences > security

name: DocuSign
notes:
Click the setup link and sign in with your email address and password, then follow the steps to set up passwordless login using biometrics to create a passkey. 

Sign out, then sign back in with your email address and choose Log in Without Password to use your passkey.

name: eBay
notes:
Select the setup link above and sign in with your email address and password, then select "Turn on" next to "Passkeys" or "Face/fingerprint/PIN sign in" section and follow the steps to create a passkey.

Sign out, then sign back in. 1Password will sign in with your passkey automatically.

name: Microsoft Entra ID
notes:
Microsoft Entra ID exclusively supports device-bound passkeys through FIDO2 security keys and the Microsoft Authenticator app. For more information: 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/authentication/how-to-enable-passkey-fido2

name: Esl Gaming
notes: Passkeys are available after successfully creating backup codes

name: Finom
notes:
To setup a passkey: 

Settings -> Security -> Passkeys

name: Fintual
notes: Passkeys are supported in the mobile application

name: FormX.ai
notes: Uses AuthGear. Setup on register or at https://auth.formextractorai.com/settings

name: FreePrints
notes:
Available within app.

Passkey is offered when signing up instead of password prompt. Also available in settings > Personal Information, tap "Save a passkey".

name: Gemini Exchange
notes:
Passkeys can be setup within iOS and available to use on desktop after.
No Android support yet.

name: GitHub
notes:
#### To save a passkey on your GitHub account
1. Navigate to your GitHub account's security settings by heading to https://github.com/settings/security or selecting the setup link above.
2. Select "Add a passkey" under "Passkeys."
3. Select "Add passkey" and follow the on-screen instructions to save a passkey to your GitHub account.

Once added, you will be able to sign in to your GitHub account by selecting "Sign in with a passkey" on the sign in page.

#### Blog post:

https://github.blog/2023-09-21-passkeys-are-generally-available/

name: Gmail
notes:
YouTube uses a Google account to sign in and Google account's have passkey support:

https://passkeys.directory/details/google/

name: Google
notes:
Visit setup link and sign in to a personal Google account with your email address and password, then follow the steps to create a passkey.

Sign out, then sign back in. You may need to click "Try another way" to see the option to use your passkey.

name: Grab (App)
notes:
Passkeys can be managed in app: 

- Settings
- Account Security
- Enable Passkey

name: haeppie
notes: Passkeys offered after sign up or sign in, after verifying email address.

name: Hancock
notes: During logon and account setup, passkeys are presented as an option. If you decide not to set up passkeys at that time, you will be prompted to set them up during application use. Should you choose not to do so, or if you want to manage your passkeys, you can go to your user profile to perform these tasks

name: My Helsana (App only)
notes: Users must sign in for the first time using their username, password and mTAN (security code sent by SMS) to access their data. They can then carry out the passkey registration in the mobile app in order to be able to log in with FaceID or TouchID. If they do not carry out the passkey registration, they can continue to log in with their username, password and mTAN.

name: Home Depot
notes: Home Depot may ask you to set up a new passkey on each new device or browser when signing in to your Home Depot account.

name: Hubspot
notes: Visit your Profile & Preferences > General > Security to add a passkey

name: World of Hyatt
notes: Hyatt.com will require verification via an emailed code in order to create or manage passkeys.

name: WealthNavi
notes:
#### To set up a passkey: 1. Enter your registered email address (WealthNavi ID) on the login screen and click "Log in with ID and password." 2. Enter your registered password and click "Login." 3. The screen will switch to the additional authentication code input screen, and the additional authentication code will be sent to your registered email address. Enter the additional authentication code you received in the authentication code field on the screen and press "Authenticate." 4. When the "Passkey" setting screen appears, press "Set."

This has been translated from Japanese.

#### Supported browsers and devices: • macOS Ventura or newer\ • Windows 10 or 11\ • iOS 16 or newer\ • Android 9 or newer\ • Chrome 109+\ • Safari 16+\ • Edge 109+

Updated on September 22, 2025

name: Indeed
notes:
#### To set up a passkey on your Indeed account: 1. Go to your account settings 2. Find the Passkey section 3. Click or tap Create passkey 4. Follow the instructions to create a new passkey #### Supported browsers and devices: • macOS Ventura or newer\ • ChromeOS 109 or newer\ • iOS 16 or newer\ • Android 9 or newer\ • Chrome 109+\ • Safari 16+\ • Edge 109+

Updated on June 24th, 2025

name: Instacart
notes:
New users signing up in the Instacart app will be asked to set up a passkey. Existing users or new users signing up through a web browser are not yet able to add a passkey to their accounts.

If you are an Instacart shopper, you are able to add a passkey to your existing account through the Shopper app.

#### To set up a passkey on your Shopper account:

Step 1: Go to the Account tab in the Shopper app.

Step 2: Tap Settings.

Step 3: Tap Set up passkey.

name: KAYAK
notes:
From the setup link, click "Sign in" > "Continue with email" to create a new account with a passkey.

Sign out, then repeat the same process to sign in with your passkey.

name: Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT)
notes: Works on all KIT websites using the Shibboleth Identity Provider for login.

name: Klemn
notes:
To add to your account go to _"Paramètres > Sécurité > Ajouter une clé d'accès"_.

To log in with a passkey, simply click _"Utiliser une clé d'accès"_ on the login screen.

name: Kraken
notes:
#### To set up a passkey: 1. Click on your profile icon in the bottom left corner of the page and select **Security** 2. Click **Add a Passkey** or a pop-up will appear. #### Supported browsers and devices: • macOS Ventura or newer\ • Windows 10 or 11\ • iOS 16 or newer\ • Android 9 or newer\ • Chrome 109+\ • Safari 16+\ • Edge 109+

Updated on September 22, 2025

name: Link by Stripe
notes: Link by Stripe offers a quick checkout solution, ensuring the secure storage of credit card information. By default, it sends 2FA codes to the customer's phone number.  However, users also have the option to create passkeys, either after signing in or from the user account menu when they are logged in.

name: LinkedIn
notes: Linkedin is actively rolling out support for saving and signing in with passkeys on LinkedIn accounts. Not all accounts have access to saving a passkey whilst LinkedIn rolls out support and you may see an error when navigating to the setup link above.

name: live.com
notes:
Live.com uses a Microsoft Account to sign in.

Microsoft Account's have passkey support:

https://passkeys.directory/details/microsoft-account

You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.

Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

name: Lululemon
notes:
#### To set up a passkey on your lululemon account: 1. Sign into your account 2. Go to your profile 3. In the security section, click "+ Add a Passkey" 4. Follow the prompts from 1Password and save

Updated on August 13, 2025

name: Microsoft
notes:
### Creating a passkey To create a passkey for your Microsoft account, follow these steps on the device for which you’d like to create a passkey: 1. [Sign in to your Microsoft account Advanced Security Options](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2250685) for personal accounts, or [MyAccount Security info](https://mysignins.microsoft.com/security-info) for work or school accounts. 2. Choose Add a new way to sign in or verify. 3. Select Face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 4. Follow the instructions on your device. 5. Provide a name for your passkey.
---
### Using your passkey to sign in To sign into your Microsoft account with a passkey, follow these steps whenever you get a sign-in prompt. 1. Choose Sign-in options, or Other ways to sign in. 2. Select Face, Fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 3. Select your passkey from the list available. Your device will open a security window where you can use your face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key.
---
You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.
Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

name: MINI
notes: MINI now supports signing in to your MINI ID with a passkey. Instructions on saving a passkey to your MINI ID may vary from region to region but more information can be found in the Account Data section of your MINI ID profile.

name: netfiles
notes: https://www.netfiles.com/de/passkey-faq

name: NHS
notes: Passkeys are supported in web browser and not currently supported in mobile application where a web view is being used to sign-in.

name: Notion
notes:
**To set up a passkey on web or desktop:**
- Go to Settings in your sidebar.
- Under My account, select Add passkey.

**To set up a passkey on mobile:**
-  Go to Settings in your sidebar.
- Under My settings, select Add passkey.

Choose where you’d like to store your passkey: in iCloud Keychain, Chrome Profile, or Password Manager.  _You can add up to five passkeys._

name: Notion
notes:
**To set up a passkey on web or desktop:**
- Go to Settings in your sidebar.
- Under My account, select Add passkey.

**To set up a passkey on mobile:**
-  Go to Settings in your sidebar.
- Under My settings, select Add passkey.

Choose where you’d like to store your passkey: in iCloud Keychain, Chrome Profile, or Password Manager.  _You can add up to five passkeys._

notes:

Sign out, then choose "Log In With Security Device" at the bottom of the page when you sign back in to use your passkey.

notes: Powered by Passage by 1Password.

OneDrive uses a Microsoft Account to sign in.

Microsoft Account's have passkey support:

https://passkeys.directory/details/microsoft-account

You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.

Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

name: OneLog
notes: OneLog may ask you to set up a new passkey on each new device or browser when signing in to your OneLog account.

name: OneLogin
notes: Passkeys Support can be enabled by an Administrator of a OneLogin environment by enabling the Webauthn authentication factor on a User Security policy which is then allocated to either a group of users or all users in the environment.

name: Online Scout Manager (OSM)
notes:
Enroll passkeys at: 

- Settings > My Account Details > Login Details > Biometrics & Security Keys.   

To sign in with passkey: 
- Enable One-Tap Log In from this same section.

You will need to enable the One-Tap Log In from each device you wish to sign in with a passkey.

name: OnlyFans
notes: Setup 'passwordless login' through Account Settings.

name: Outlook Mail
notes:
Outlook uses a Microsoft Account to sign in.

Microsoft Account's have passkey support:

https://passkeys.directory/details/microsoft-account

You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.

Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

name: SK Telecom passkey demo
notes: This is a demo site for anybody to experience trying out passkeys.

name: Descope passkeys demo
notes: Passkeys demo powered by descope

name: PayFit
notes: PayFit do not explicitly call setting up 'biometric authentication' option as a passkey or use terminology/iconography from the FIDO passkey guidelines but these are passkeys.

name: PayPal
notes:
Passkeys on PayPal can be created on mobile devices in Chrome on Android or iOS and in Safari on iOS.

- [How to log in to PayPal with a passkey](https://www.paypal.com/us/cshelp/article/how-to-log-in-to-paypal-with-a-passkey-help997)
- [What is a passkey and how do I use it to log in to my PayPal account?](https://www.paypal.com/us/cshelp/article/what-is-a-passkey-and-how-do-i-use-it-to-log-in-to-my-paypal-account-help997)


### Confirmed Location Support
- [United States](https://newsroom.paypal-corp.com/2022-10-24-PayPal-Introduces-More-Secure-Payments-with-Passkeys)
- Canada
- [United Kingdom](https://newsroom.uk.paypal-corp.com/2023-06-27-PayPal-Expands-Passkeys-to-the-UK)
- [Germany](https://newsroom.deatch.paypal-corp.com/PayPal-weitet-Passkeys-nach-Deutschland-aus)

name: PlayStation
notes:
Go password-free with your account for PlayStation Network. Passkeys offer a faster and more secure account sign-in experience by letting you sign in through your mobile device or computer using the same convenient device unlocking method, like a fingerprint, face scan or PIN. Visit www.playstation.com/passkey to learn more. 

[Watch: Introducing Passkey for PlayStation on Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uKfQrqMS9s8 )

name: Practice Protect
notes: Signing in with passkeys must be enabled by an admin via the back-end of the admin portal, and sign in at the individuals Practice Protect URL. Admins can use the following article to setup passkey authentication to the platform.

name: rad.dad
notes: Powered by Passage by 1Password.

name: Ring
notes: Signing in with passkeys is only supported in the Ring app on iOS 16 or later and Android 9 or later.

name: Robinhood
notes:
Saving a passkey for a Robinhood account is only supported on iOS devices running iOS 16 or later and the latest version of the Robinhood app. 

#### To set up a passkey on your Robinhood account on iOS:

1. Open the Robinhood app.
2. Select Account > select Menu/Settings > then select Security and Privacy.
3. Select Create passkey, then select Continue.
4. Follow the on-screen instructions to save a passkey for Robinhood.

name: Roblox
notes:
### Setting up passkeys: 

- Navigate to Settings on your iOS app or web browser. Log in if prompted.
*Note: Android support will be coming soon*
- Under Account Info > Login Methods > Passkeys, press the “Add passkey” button.
- Note: You may need to verify your identity with your password or a one-time code sent to your email.

To complete adding a passkey, you will be asked to unlock your device.


### Manage your passkeys

Go to Settings on your iOS app or web browser. Login to your account if prompted.

*Note: Android support will be coming soon*
- Under Account Info > Login Methods > Passkeys, press the “Manage” button.
- Press the trashcan icon next to the passkey you want to remove.
- You may be asked to verify your identity using passwords or an email one-time code.

name: Shakepay
notes:
#### To set up a passkey on your Shakepay account:

1. In the Shakepay app, enter the settings page by clicking the gear icon or selecting the setup link above.
2. Select ‘Security & privacy’
3. Select ‘Passkeys’
4. Select ‘Add new passkey’ and follow the on-screen instructions.

name: Shopify
notes:
Sign in to Shopify with your email address and password, then follow the steps in the documentation link above to create a passkey. 

Sign out, then sign back in with your email address and choose "Log in with passkey" to use your passkey.

name: Sirius XM Satellite Radio
notes: Passkeys are offered after successful sign-in.

name: SK Telecom
notes: Passkeys are available for both SK Telecom and SK Telecom 3rd parties

name: Snapchat
notes:
1. Tap ⚙️ in your Profile to open Settings
2. Scroll down to ‘My Account’ and find ‘Passkeys’
3. Tap ‘Add Passkey’ and follow the instructions in the app

name: Tailscale
notes: Saving and signing in with passkeys on Tailscale is limited to new user accounts only.  Users also cannot create a new tailnet using passkey key authentication. The tailnet must first be created using a different authentication method then invited users can use passkey authentication for their accounts.

name: Deutsche Telekom
notes: Passkeys can be set up through a prompt directly after login

name: Tender
notes: Tender only supports passkeys for authentication

name: Ticketmaster
notes:
#### To set up a passkey: 1. Sign into ticketmaster 2. Navigate to **My Account** → **My Profile** → **Sign In & Security** 3. Add a passkey 4. Follow the prompts from 1Password #### Supported browsers and devices: • macOS Ventura or newer\ • Windows 10 or 11\ • iOS 16 or newer\ • Android 9 or newer\ • Chrome 109+\ • Safari 16+\ • Edge 109+ **Currently, passkeys are not available on the ticketmaster mobile app.**

Updated on September 22, 2025

name: TikTok
notes:
TikTok is rolling out passkeys for iOS to users and requires the following criteria to be met:
- Have an Apple device running iOS 16 or macOS Ventura or later.
- iCloud Keychain must be turned on in your Apple device settings.
- Two-factor authentication must be turned on for your Apple ID.

#### To set up a passkey on your TikTok account:

1. In the TikTok app, tap Profile at the bottom.
2. Tap the Menu button at the top.
3. Tap Settings and privacy.
4. Tap Account.
5. Tap iCloud passkey, then tap Set up on the next screen and follow the instructions provided to complete setup.

name: Trimble
notes:
Passkeys can be created when you create an account and for existing users in your profile under the passkey section. Passkeys can also be used as a multi-factor authentication (MFA) method.

You are allowed a max of 3 passkeys for your account.

Once a passkey has been added to your account you can authenticate with passkeys as an MFA method or on the first step of authentication by clicking the passkey button.

name: Trusona Authentication Cloud
notes: Requires a commercial license. Contact Trusona at info@trusona.com for more information.

name: Trustworthy
notes: Available on iOS after signing up / signing in.

name: Ubank
notes: Available in ubank app

name: usesarchbtw.lol
notes: After setting up a password it will prompt for a yubikey, passkey or finally TOTP if neither are available.

name: VerifyThisSeal.com
notes:
#### To set up a passkey: 1. Sign into VerifyThisSeal.com 2. Navigate to **Account Details** → **Security Settings** → **Passkeys** #### Supported browsers and devices: • macOS Ventura or newer\ • Windows 10 or 11\ • iOS 16 or newer\ • Android 9 or newer\ • Chrome 109+\ • Safari 16+\ • Edge 109+

Updated on September 22, 2025

name: vk
notes: VK.com / VK.ru provide passkey sign in using their 'OnePass' ID. A phone number or email address is required to create a passkey.

name: Voura
notes:
When signing up for Voura, you will be automatically prompted to save a passkey for your account.

Powered by Passage by 1Password.

name: Walmart
notes:
Only available through the mobile app and on consumer accounts. 

Passkeys only work with 1Password in the iOS and Android app, not the walmart.com website

name: Webull
notes: Please note passkeys are only used for the Webull app, they are not available on the Desktop platform.

name: WhatsApp (iOS and Android)
notes:
Saving and signing in with a passkey on Whatsapp is currently limited to the iOS and Android apps. Signing in to the Mac desktop version or on the web browser version of Whatsapp still requires using the "Linked Devices" feature or scanning the QR code using your mobile device.

#### To set up a passkey on your Whatsapp account:
1. Go to your WhatsApp settings.
2. Tap Passkeys > Create a passkey.
3. Tap Continue.
- You may be asked to tap Use screen lock to create your passkey.

name: X (Twitter) iOS
notes:
X (formerly Twitter) is rolling out signing in with passkeys support to all accounts on iOS. No other platforms are able to save a passkey to their accounts at this time.

**To set up a passkey on your X account:**
1. Log in to the X app with the account you wish to enable passkey for.
2. Select Your account in the navigation bar.
3. Select Settings and privacy, select Security and account access, then Security.
4. Under Additional password protection, select Passkey.
5. Enter your password when prompted.
6. Select Add a passkey and follow the on-screen prompts.

name: Yahoo! JAPAN
notes: https://fidoalliance.org/yahoo-japan-announces-support-for-passkeys-across-available-platforms/

name: Yahoo!
notes: Passkeys can be setup after signing in from a mobile device.

name: Zitadel
notes:
Partial passkey support verified with a desktop browser and 1Password extension.  

Some intermittent issues with mobile Safari.

name: Zoho
notes: Recently updated this listing to include passkey support for signing in, in addition to MFA.
